# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return lowercase(strip(col)) do |c|
        if c == '-' || c == ' '
            '_'
        else
            c
        end
    end
end
```

This function takes an `AbstractString` as input and returns a lowercased, stripped, and sanitized string with replaced whitespace characters. It uses the `strip` function to remove leading and trailing whitespaces, and a custom transformation function within the `do` block to replace spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `lowercase` function is then applied to the result to ensure that the column name is lowercase.
